about.metaDescription: Learn how Protest Listing centralizes protest information and how you can contribute.
about.title: About
about.heroSubtitle: A collaborative open-source platform to centralize and normalize information about upcoming protests and demonstrations.

mission.title: Our mission
paragraphs: We believe that information about civic engagement opportunities should be easily accessible to everyone. Unfortunately, protest and demonstration details are often scattered across hard-to-reach corners of the internet, making it difficult for people to stay informed.

This platform was born from the frustration of trying to find a centralized list of upcoming protests. What should be simple public information felt deliberately difficult to access. We want to change that by creating an open, collaborative solution that aggregates and normalizes data from many sources.

how.title: How it works
how.intro: Our platform combines automated data collection with community contributions to provide comprehensive protest listings:

automation.title: Automated scraping
automation.description: We automatically collect event data from official sources such as police registrations, city portals, and established organizations to ensure broad coverage.

community.title: Community contributions
community.description: Registered users can submit missing events while moderators verify submissions to maintain data quality and prevent misinformation.

sources.title: Current data sources
sources.intro: We currently aggregate data from these trusted sources, with more being added regularly:

comingSoon.title: Coming soon
comingSoon.intro: We are continuously improving the platform with new features:

items.title: Data export & downloads
items.description: Export filtered event data in CSV, JSON, or ICS formats.

items.title: Subscribable calendars
items.description: Custom ICS feeds for specific time ranges and filters.

items.title: Advanced filtering
items.description: More detailed search options and categorisation.

items.title: Contact form
items.description: An easy way to suggest new sources and share feedback.

items.title: User registration system
items.description: Allow community members to manually add missing events.

developers.title: For developers & contributors
developers.intro: This is an open-source project and we welcome contributions from developers who share our vision of accessible civic information:
developers.apiDescription: Our REST API provides programmatic access to protest data with comprehensive filtering options:
developers.apiFilters: Filter by city, country, date range, geolocation, source, language, and more.
developers.apiMore: Export data in JSON, CSV, or subscribable ICS formats—perfect for building your own applications or integrations.
developers.cta: Want to help? Open an issue or submit a pull request on GitHub.

openSource.title: Free & open source forever
paragraphs: This project is and will always remain completely free and open source. Access to civic engagement information should never hide behind paywalls or proprietary systems.

Licensed under AGPL-3.0, our codebase is transparent, auditable, and built to benefit the entire community. Whether you are a citizen looking for local events or a developer extending the project, you are welcome here.

contact.title: Get involved
contact.intro: We would love to hear from you! Whether you have suggestions for new data sources, found a bug, or want to contribute code:

sections.title: General inquiries
sections.description: For suggestions about new sources to scrape or general feedback, email us or use the upcoming contact form.

sections.title: Technical issues
sections.description: Found a bug or have a feature request? Open an issue on GitHub for the fastest response from the development team.

important.title: Important information
paragraphs: This platform aggregates protest information from public sources and user submissions. While we strive for accuracy, we cannot guarantee the completeness or correctness of all listings.
Please verify event details independently before attending. We are not the organisers of listed events and do not endorse specific political views—we simply make civic information easier to access.
